meanings.sent1: The hake swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating hake with lemon and herbs.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hake refuse to share its seaweed salad? Because it was a little shellfish!
meanings.sent4: The hake moved through the water like a silver arrow.
meanings.sent5: The hake's scales shimmered in the sunlight, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To catch or obtain something by trickery or deceit.
meanings.sent1: He tried to hake his way into getting free tickets.
meanings.sent2: She managed to hake some extra time off work.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to hake a rabbit out of the hat failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The con artist haked his victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent5: The spy haked valuable information from the enemy's database.
